TopicTitle: Does Relay require a probe core to operate?

Articles.Content:
I was considering taking a stochastic approach to a comms network: a myriad of tiny sats stashed under a fairing, attached to separators (many sats per separator) pointing in random directions, with just the antennas, Ant engines, Oscar-B fuel tanks (or even just separatrons!), and no guidance whatsoever. Launch the carrier into a relatively high orbit, , let them occupy any orbits they will land on when they run out of fuel, having no guidance or control whatsoever, operating under the 'debris' mark. Simply put, an artificial asteroid belt around Kerbin. The idea though is NOT to have probe cores on them.

Would that work?

Just now, Sereneti said:

afaik yes.

 

Yes they require, or yes that would work?

afaik: yes that would work.

but maybee the the developer had changed that...

You'd have to turn you max constant debris setting way up so none of them ever get deleted.

As far as I know it would work in theory but I've never tried it.

Why not be the first, and come back here and let us all know how it went?
No, it won't work now. In early 1.2 beta it did, but then the requirement was added that a relay antenna has to be attached to a functioning (still has power) ship.
